parks.name: Japanese Garden
parks.review: This park is really cool, due the fact, that we visited it spontaniously. It's a small peace of Japan in Wroclaw. This park is small, but really comfortable. The entrance here for student costs 5 zloty. This park is really chill, and flowers there right now are in full bloom, colorful and decorative. I definitely recommend to enter before 12 at the weekend, less queue :)

parks.name: Park Szczytnicki
parks.review: One of my favorite places, were I often come back because of the amazing atmosphere. You can lay down and just relax which is missing in many parks. I recommend it to everyone!

parks.name: Park Wschodni
parks.review: I recommend this park for people who are thirsty for a break from the hustle and bustle of the city, because the park is quite large and wild. It's a great place for walking with sticks, running, because you can calm down and feel like in the forest for a while. :) The minus is the lack of lighting lamps and the bridge, in front of which there has been a notice of renovation for over a year - so far nothing has changed in this matter.

parks.name: Park Południowy
parks.review: Clean, quiet, beautiful! I had the opportunity to walk many times after dark, alleys illuminated. Perfect for those who care about greenery and cleanliness. I have an impression that the inhabitants of Wrocław can take care of their surroundings.

parks.name: Park Juliusza Słowackiego
parks.review: A moment of respite in the city center. There are very many benches, you can relax a little, especially on hot days. In the park there are several monuments and sculptures, rich vegetation. Near the park many different attractions - National Museum, Raclawice Panorama, Museum of Post and Telecommunication, Museum of Architecture ....

parks.name: Park Brochowski
parks.review: Out of the way as far as downtown is concerned but also good for a nice walk. Trees are lower and less dense than in other parks in the city. On the plus side there are aesthetic footbridges and the fact that the park is being expanded, new trees were planted. Even the proximity of railroad tracks adds charm and individuality to this place. In the middle of the park maze as an attraction for children and not only. On the negative side muddy paths, no gravel, no paving, and no direct parking.

parks.name: Old town garden
parks.review: The park (Ogród Staromiejski) resembles the pre-war city garden - with high, openwork fence, spruce lawns and charming alleys in the 19th century arrangement. It is located in the very centre of Wrocław.
